KISD Families,

Earlier today we did confirm our first COVID-positive student at our Early Childhood Campus. The student was on campus for a brief time Monday morning before exhibiting symptoms, being assessed and then sent home. The student who tested positive and anyone in close contact with the student will not return to school until they have met the criteria to return safely. Extensive cleaning of the classrooms and common areas has taken place.
KISD Active Positive Cases will now be recorded on our district website. Near the bottom of the homepage, in the photo collage is a photo of masks that turns red when you hover over it, with COVID Dashboard. That will take you to the district COVID dashboard that will be updated on a regular basis with the current number of active COVID cases identified in currently enrolled students and employees.

Kerrville Public School Foundation
August 28 at 11:36 AM ·

Dear KISD Teachers,

We are incredibly proud to see our virtual and in-person KISD schools up and running for the 2020-2021 year! As a token of our gratitude, the Kerrville Public School Foundation is happy to announce our Caring During COVID Initiative. Under this initiative, KPSF will provide each KISD teacher a $100 gift card to H-E-B for classroom needs. We know that many of you often spend funds for your classrooms out of your own pockets, and we hope this gift card lets you know how much we appreciate your efforts on behalf of our KISD students. You will receive your gift cards early next week from your school principal.

Thanks for making the 2020-2021 school year a reality for our students and families.

Have a great year,

KPSF Board of Directors

#FinishStrongKISD

This isn't the way we wanted to finish out the school year. More than anything, we wanted to see our students and staff back in the buildings before the last day of school.
Online learning from home isn't ideal for everyone and presents many challenges for all teachers, parents and students involved. But it also offers some opportunities: to focus on the end goal, show GRIT and finish strong. Schools may be closed, but learning isn't cancelled.
In every classroom in the district is our Profile of a Graduate poster with the five characteristics every KISD graduate should have. Now, maybe more than ever, our students need to show grit and stay goal-focused to finish out the school year strong.
Over the next several weeks, we'll be sharing encouragement and motivation from our students and staff so that we can #FinishStrongKISD.

An update to parents about the school closure was emailed to parents earlier this evening following the announcement from the governor. The text of the letter is copied below:

Dear KISD Parents,

I hope this letter finds you safe and healthy.

Earlier today, Governor Greg Abbott announced that schools will remain closed for the rest of the school year. We are saddened by this decision, but know it is made in the best interest of safety for our students, staff and community.

We will continue our Virtual KISD online learning and meal program for the remainder of the school year. Decisions about closing out the semester and graduation for our seniors will be made and communicated in the coming weeks.

We are disappointed that we will not see our students return to their campuses this year, but we will get through this together and look forward to seeing them again for the start of the new school year in August.

Thank you for your continued patience and support during this time.

Sincerely,
Mark J. Foust
Superintendent

Students in Mrs. Hoermann's and Ms. Brodbeck's fourth grade classes at Starkey packed their sleeping bags and blankets and went camping last week! Not really, but both teachers turned their classrooms into a campground for students to get cozy and work on their argumentative writing. Students were given four different writing prompts to choose from and then used the writing process to come up with three arguments to support their idea and write a paper.
We'd say this beats sitting at a desk doing timed writing any day of the week! Just one of the many innovative and fun ways our teachers use to make learning fun!

post_text: BTW students were introduced to their next chapter of study in science this week with a Rock Science Theater. As part of the inquiry-based learning, students were given a little information about the three main types of rocks (sedimentary, igneous and metamorphic) and then rotated through stations where they made and recorded observations of rocks. At the end, students from Ms. Robinett's, Mrs. Shim's and Mr. Johnson's classes came back together and learned which rocks were in which category. Students will now dive into the subject more deeply with labs! What a fun way to get out of the classroom for hands-on learning!

post_text: Way to go, Tom Daniels Robotics Team! Bringing positive change not just to their campus, but to the environment also!
shared_text:
City of Kerrville, TX - City Hall
February 18 at 8:59 AM ·

TOM DANIELS ROBOTICS TEAM WINS AWARD

The Tom Daniels Elementary School Mustangs Robotics Team recently captured first place in the Grand Champion Robotics competition at Schreiner University. After seeing single-use plastic water bottles everywhere, the team designed a limited edition sticker to bring awareness to the issue. The money raised by these stickers will be used to purchase more reusable bottles.

Team members Addison Wrase and Olivia Wrase and coach Elizabeth Wrase dropped by City Hall last week to show the logo to City of Kerrville Assistant Public Works Director David Barrera.

“These types of initiatives by our community are very much appreciated, and we’re glad to help support them,” Barrera said. “Our department’s other assistant director, Scott Loveland, has purchased stickers and plans to add them to one of our educational outreach campaigns beginning soon.”

The Tom Daniels Robotics Team has also been instrumental in adding a water bottle refill station at Tom Daniels.

December 11, 2019 at 9:37 AM ·

TALLY ROBOTICS TEAM VISITS CITY COUNCIL

The Tally Robotics Team, a group of fifth-grade students from Tally Elementary School, presented a plan to City Council Tuesday night proposing the addition of bike paths on the sidewalks near the currently-under-construction Hal Peterson Middle School.

The Robotics team's vision is to "make a difference in our community" - a vision that includes putting more bike paths and more sidewalks in Kerrville.

The City of Kerrville thanks the team - Hailey Van Nostrand, Alexis Rodgers, Lillian Zamudio, Danna Cisneros, Brooke Wilson, Denton Taylor, Caleb Elliston, Aiden Pucek, and Reid Clarkson, and their coach and principal, Marilyn Mitchell and Gena Robertson - for taking time to visit with us!

Tivy Marching Band made it to the state marching contest two weeks ago. The HPMS 7th grade B team went undefeated and were the district champions. shared_text:
City of Kerrville, TX - City Hall
October 17, 2019 at 4:41 PM ·

KISD STUDENTS LEARNING ABOUT CITY GOVERNMENT

This morning students from the KISD Challenge Lab program visited City Hall for a tour of the city led by Councilmember Kim Clarkson, Planning Director Drew Paxton, and Sherry Mosier, Manager Strategic Initiatives. The program of study is called Utopian Destinations and through hands-on activities, students gain awareness of ways in which people in the local community and other communities meet their needs for government, education, communication, transportation, and recreation. Students compare and contrast urban and rural locations, as well as study on how cities evolve over time. Additionally, students examine how humans modify or adapt to their environments and how cities form around natural resources. Student learning culminates in a proposal and presentation for a new city, complete with a charter, governance structure, services outline, transportation plan, maps, and materials for promoting tourism and business development. Utopian Destination allows students to imagine, research, plan and design the city of their dreams.

post_text: Hal Peterson Middle School and B.T. Wilson Sixth Grade Campus kicked off their fundraiser with pep rallies today! Both schools are collecting gently used shoes starting Oct. 1 through Nov. 21. The schools will receive money based on the number of pounds of shoes they collect. The shoes will be sent to third world countries. For updates and information about the shoe drive, like and follow BTW & HPMS Shoe Fundraiser page.
